name: ColdFusion: Avoid using inline-IF (IIF)
description:
Report all use of iif.
Rule could be improved to report usage of iif with de() since it compound the slowness.
output:
This report lists all Templates that use iif function.
. It provides the following information:
- Template full name
- Number of iif
rationale:
IIF runs about twice as slow as a  <cfif >/ <cfelse > block
Slow performance is compunded when used in conjunction with a delayed evaluation DE function.
remediation:
As you can see, you can use a simple inline operator without having to worry about IIF quirks or drawn out conditional statements. Remember this is introduced in ColdFusion 9.
Or you can just do:
#(len(arguments.arg1))#
Since CF treats positive numbers as a true value and zero as a false value it will work. If you want to be more explicit, you can use:
#(len(arguments.arg1) gt 0)#
It certainly works in CF6+.
